108396.text:
a new client side metric `rest_client_request_retries_total` has been added that tracks 
the number of retries sent to the server, partitioned by status code, verb, and host
108396.markdown:
A new client side metric `rest_client_request_retries_total` has been added that tracks 
  the number of retries sent to the server, partitioned by status code, verb, and host ([#108396](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/108396), [@tkashem](https://github.com/tkashem)) [SIG API Machinery, Architecture and Instrumentation]
108396.author: tkashem

112393.text: Two changes to the /debug/api_priority_and_fairness/dump_priority_levels endpoint of API Priority and Fairness: add total number of dispatched, timed-out, rejected and cancelled requests; output now sorted by PriorityLevelName.
112393.markdown: Two changes to the /debug/api_priority_and_fairness/dump_priority_levels endpoint of API Priority and Fairness: add total number of dispatched, timed-out, rejected and cancelled requests; output now sorted by PriorityLevelName. 112809.text:
kube-apiserver: regular expressions specified with the `--cors-allowed-origins` option are now validated to match the entire `hostname` inside the `Origin` header of the request and 
must contain '^' or the '//' prefix to anchor to the start, and '$' or the port separator ':' to anchor to 
the end.
112809.markdown:
Kube-apiserver: regular expressions specified with the `--cors-allowed-origins` option are now validated to match the entire `hostname` inside the `Origin` header of the request and 
  must contain '^' or the '//' prefix to anchor to the start, and '$' or the port separator ':' to anchor to 
  the end. ([#112809](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/112809), [@tkashem](https://github.com/tkashem)) [SIG API Machinery]
112809.author: tkashem

114376.author: baomingwang

114418.text: New feature gate, ServiceNodePortStaticSubrange, to enable the new strategy in the NodePort Service port allocators, so the node port range is subdivided and dynamic allocated NodePort port for Services are allocated preferentially from the upper range.
114418.markdown: New feature gate, ServiceNodePortStaticSubrange, to enable the new strategy in the NodePort Service port allocators, so the node port range is subdivided and dynamic allocated NodePort port for Services are allocated preferentially from the upper range. ([#114418](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/114418), [@xuzhenglun](https://github.com/xuzhenglun)) [SIG Network]
114418.author: xuzhenglun

114472.text:
Kubelet no longer creates certain legacy iptables rules by default.
It is possible that this will cause problems with some third-party components
that improperly depended on those rules. If this affects you, you can run
kubelet with `--feature-gates=IPTablesOwnershipCleanup=false`, but you should
also file a bug against the third-party component.
114472.markdown:
Kubelet no longer creates certain legacy iptables rules by default.
  It is possible that this will cause problems with some third-party components
  that improperly depended on those rules. If this affects you, you can run
  kubelet with `--feature-gates=IPTablesOwnershipCleanup=false`, but you should
  also file a bug against the third-party component. ([#114472](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/114472), [@danwinship](https://github.com/danwinship)) [SIG Network]
114472.author: danwinship

114490.text: Changes docs for --contention-profiling flag to reflect it performs block profiling
114490.markdown: Changes docs for --contention-profiling flag to reflect it performs block profiling ([#114490](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/114490), [@MadhavJivrajani](https://github.com/MadhavJivrajani)) [SIG API Machinery, Cloud Provider, Docs, Node and Scheduling]
114490.author: MadhavJivrajani

([#114997](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/114997), [@Richabanker](https://github.com/Richabanker)) [SIG API Machinery, Apps, Architecture, Auth, Autoscaling, CLI, Cloud Provider, Cluster Lifecycle, Instrumentation, Network, Node, Release, Scheduling, Storage and Testing]

115038.markdown: Kubeadm: fix an etcd learner-mode bug by preparing an etcd static pod manifest before promoting ([#115038](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/115038), [@tobiasgiese](https://github.com/tobiasgiese)) [SIG Cluster Lifecycle]

115137.text: Add kubelet Topology Manager metrics to track admission requests processed by it and occured admission errors.
115137.markdown: Add kubelet Topology Manager metrics to track admission requests processed by it and occured admission errors. ([#115137](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/115137), [@swatisehgal](https://github.com/swatisehgal)) [SIG Node and Testing]
115137.author: swatisehgal

115138.text:
A new feature has been enabled to improve the performance of the iptables mode of kube-proxy in large clusters. You do not need to take any action, however:

1. If you experience problems with Services not syncing to iptables correctly, you can disable the feature by passing `--feature-gates=MinimizeIPTablesRestore=false` to kube-proxy (and file a bug if this fixes it). (This might also be detected by seeing the value of kube-proxy's `sync_proxy_rules_iptables_partial_restore_failures_total` metric rising.)
2. If you were previously overriding the kube-proxy configuration for performance reasons, this may no longer be necessary. See https://kubernetes.io/docs/reference/networking/virtual-ips/#optimizing-iptables-mode-performance.
115138.markdown:
A new feature has been enabled to improve the performance of the iptables mode of kube-proxy in large clusters. You do not need to take any action, however:
  
  1. If you experience problems with Services not syncing to iptables correctly, you can disable the feature by passing `--feature-gates=MinimizeIPTablesRestore=false` to kube-proxy (and file a bug if this fixes it). (This might also be detected by seeing the value of kube-proxy's `sync_proxy_rules_iptables_partial_restore_failures_total` metric rising.)
  2. If you were previously overriding the kube-proxy configuration for performance reasons, this may no longer be necessary. See https://kubernetes.io/docs/reference/networking/virtual-ips/#optimizing-iptables-mode-performance. ([#115138](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/115138), [@danwinship](https://github.com/danwinship)) [SIG Network]
115138.author: danwinship

115179.text: Fix nil pointer error in nodevolumelimits csi logging
115179.markdown: Fix nil pointer error in nodevolumelimits csi logging ([#115179](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/115179), [@sunnylovestiramisu](https://github.com/sunnylovestiramisu)) [SIG Scheduling]
115179.author: sunnylovestiramisu

115310.markdown: Etcd: Update to v3.5.7 ([#115310](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/115310), [@mzaian](https://github.com/mzaian)) [SIG API Machinery, Cloud Provider, Cluster Lifecycle and Testing]
115310.author: mzaian

115315.text: The Kubernetes API server now correctly detects and closes existing TLS connections when its client certificate file for kubelet authentication has been rotated.
115315.markdown: The Kubernetes API server now correctly detects and closes existing TLS connections when its client certificate file for kubelet authentication has been rotated. ([#115315](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/115315), [@enj](https://github.com/enj)) [SIG API Machinery, Auth, Node and Testing]
115315.author: enj

115321.text: GRPC probes now set a linger option of 1s to improve the TIME-WAIT state.
115321.markdown: GRPC probes now set a linger option of 1s to improve the TIME-WAIT state. ([#115321](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/115321), [@rphillips](https://github.com/rphillips)) [SIG Network and Node]
115321.author: rphillips

115322.text: Fix a bug that caused to panic the apiserver when trying to allocate a Service with a dynamic ClusterIP and it has been configured with Service CIDRs with a /28 mask for IPv4 and a /124 mask for IPv6
115322.markdown: Fix a bug that caused to panic the apiserver when trying to allocate a Service with a dynamic ClusterIP and it has been configured with Service CIDRs with a /28 mask for IPv4 and a /124 mask for IPv6 ([#115322](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/115322), [@aojea](https://github.com/aojea)) [SIG Testing]
115322.author: aojea

115341.text: Fix the regression that introduced 34s timeout for DELETECOLLECTION calls
115341.markdown: Fix the regression that introduced 34s timeout for DELETECOLLECTION calls ([#115341](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/115341), [@tkashem](https://github.com/tkashem)) [SIG API Machinery]
115341.author: tkashem

115346.text: Set device stage path whenever available for expansion during mount
115346.markdown: Set device stage path whenever available for expansion during mount ([#115346](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/115346), [@gnufied](https://github.com/gnufied)) [SIG Storage and Testing]
115346.author: gnufied

115349.text: Fixed bug which caused the status of Indexed Jobs to only be updated when there are newly completed indexes. The completed indexes are now updated if the .status.completedIndexes has values outside of the [0, .spec.completions> range
115349.markdown: Fixed bug which caused the status of Indexed Jobs to only be updated when there are newly completed indexes. The completed indexes are now updated if the .status.completedIndexes has values outside of the [0, .spec.completions> range ([#115349](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/115349), [@danielvegamyhre](https://github.com/danielvegamyhre)) [SIG Apps]
115349.author: danielvegamyhre

115354.text: A fix in the resource.k8s.io/v1alpha1/ResourceClaim API avoids harmless (?) ".status.reservedFor: element 0: associative list without keys has an element that's a map type" errors in the apiserver. Validation now rejects the incorrect reuse of the same UID in different entries.
115354.markdown: A fix in the resource.k8s.io/v1alpha1/ResourceClaim API avoids harmless (?) ".status.reservedFor: element 0: associative list without keys has an element that's a map type" errors in the apiserver. Validation now rejects the incorrect reuse of the same UID in different entries. ([#115354](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/115354), [@pohly](https://github.com/pohly)) [SIG API Machinery]
115354.author: pohly

115363.text: The PodDisruptionBudget `spec.unhealthyPodEvictionPolicy` field has graduated to beta and is enabled by default. On servers with the feature enabled, this field may be set to `AlwaysAllow` to always allow unhealthy pods covered by the PodDisruptionBudget to be evicted.
115363.markdown: The PodDisruptionBudget `spec.unhealthyPodEvictionPolicy` field has graduated to beta and is enabled by default. On servers with the feature enabled, this field may be set to `AlwaysAllow` to always allow unhealthy pods covered by the PodDisruptionBudget to be evicted. ([#115363](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/115363), [@ravisantoshgudimetla](https://github.com/ravisantoshgudimetla)) [SIG Apps, Auth and Node]
115363.author: ravisantoshgudimetla

115377.text: The go version defined in `.go-version` is now fetched when invoking test, build, and code generation targets if the current go version does not match it. Set $FORCE_HOST_GO=y while testing or building to skip this behavior, or set $GO_VERSION to override the selected go version.
115377.markdown: The go version defined in `.go-version` is now fetched when invoking test, build, and code generation targets if the current go version does not match it. Set $FORCE_HOST_GO=y while testing or building to skip this behavior, or set $GO_VERSION to override the selected go version. ([#115377](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/115377), [@liggitt](https://github.com/liggitt)) [SIG Testing]
115377.author: liggitt

115379.text: The mount-utils mounter now provides an option to limit the number of concurrent format operations.
115379.markdown: The mount-utils mounter now provides an option to limit the number of concurrent format operations. ([#115379](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/115379), [@artemvmin](https://github.com/artemvmin)) [SIG API Machinery, Architecture, Auth, CLI, Cloud Provider, Cluster Lifecycle, Instrumentation, Network, Node and Storage]
115379.author: artemvmin

115434.text: Update API reference for Requests, specifying they must not exceed limits
115434.markdown: Update API reference for Requests, specifying they must not exceed limits ([#115434](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/115434), [@ehashman](https://github.com/ehashman)) [SIG Architecture, Docs and Node]
115434.author: ehashman

115454.text: Promote pod resource limit/request metrics to stable.
115454.markdown: Promote pod resource limit/request metrics to stable. ([#115454](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/115454), [@dgrisonnet](https://github.com/dgrisonnet)) [SIG Instrumentation and Scheduling]
115454.author: dgrisonnet

115464.text:
Fix an issue where a CSI migrated volume may be prematurely detached when the CSI driver is not running on the node.
If CSI migration is enabled on the node, even the csi-driver is not up and ready, we will still add this volume to DSW.
115464.markdown:
Fix an issue where a CSI migrated volume may be prematurely detached when the CSI driver is not running on the node.
  If CSI migration is enabled on the node, even the csi-driver is not up and ready, we will still add this volume to DSW. ([#115464](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/115464), [@sunnylovestiramisu](https://github.com/sunnylovestiramisu)) [SIG Apps and Storage]
115464.author: sunnylovestiramisu

115503.text: Fixing issue with Winkernel Proxier - IPV6 load balancer policies are missing when service is configured with ipFamilyPolicy: RequireDualStack
115503.markdown: Fixing issue with Winkernel Proxier - IPV6 load balancer policies are missing when service is configured with ipFamilyPolicy: RequireDualStack ([#115503](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/115503), [@princepereira](https://github.com/princepereira)) [SIG Network and Windows]
115503.author: princepereira

115514.text: k8s.io/client-go/tools/record.EventBroadcaster: after Shutdown() is called, the broadcaster now gives up immediately after a failure to write an event to a sink. Previously it tried multiple times for 12 seconds in a goroutine.
115514.markdown: K8s.io/client-go/tools/record.EventBroadcaster: after Shutdown() is called, the broadcaster now gives up immediately after a failure to write an event to a sink. Previously it tried multiple times for 12 seconds in a goroutine. ([#115514](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/115514), [@pohly](https://github.com/pohly)) [SIG API Machinery]
115514.author: pohly

115569.author: Huang-Wei

115620.text: Fix missing delete events on informer re-lists to ensure all delete events are correctly emitted and using the latest known object state, so that all event handlers and stores always reflect the actual apiserver state as best as possible
115620.markdown: Fix missing delete events on informer re-lists to ensure all delete events are correctly emitted and using the latest known object state, so that all event handlers and stores always reflect the actual apiserver state as best as possible ([#115620](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/115620), [@odinuge](https://github.com/odinuge)) [SIG API Machinery]

115649.text: Added apiserver_envelope_encryption_kms_operations_latency_seconds metric to measure the KMSv2 grpc calls latency.
115649.markdown: Added apiserver_envelope_encryption_kms_operations_latency_seconds metric to measure the KMSv2 grpc calls latency. ([#115649](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/115649), [@aramase](https://github.com/aramase)) [SIG API Machinery, Auth and Testing]
115649.author: aramase

115652.text: Scheduler doesn't run plugin's Score method when its PreScore method returned a Skip status. In other words, your PreScore/Score plugin can return a Skip status in PreScore if the plugin does nothing in Score for that Pod.
115652.markdown: Scheduler doesn't run plugin's Score method when its PreScore method returned a Skip status. In other words, your PreScore/Score plugin can return a Skip status in PreScore if the plugin does nothing in Score for that Pod. ([#115652](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/115652), [@kidddddddddddddddddddddd](https://github.com/kidddddddddddddddddddddd)) [SIG Scheduling]
115652.author: kidddddddddddddddddddddd

115678.text: e2e framework: added `--report-complete-ginkgo` and `--report-complete-junit` parameters. They work like `ginkgo --json-report <report dir>/ginkgo/report.json --junit-report <report dir>/ginkgo/report.xml`.
115678.markdown: E2e framework: added `--report-complete-ginkgo` and `--report-complete-junit` parameters. They work like `ginkgo --json-report <report dir>/ginkgo/report.json --junit-report <report dir>/ginkgo/report.xml`. ([#115678](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/115678), [@pohly](https://github.com/pohly)) [SIG Testing]
115678.author: pohly

115712.text: Added "netadmin" debugging profiles for kubectl debug.
115712.markdown: Added "netadmin" debugging profiles for kubectl debug. ([#115712](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/115712), [@wedaly](https://github.com/wedaly)) [SIG CLI]
115712.author: wedaly
